alert.note: Alert for Greene (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 1:02AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following county, Greene. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 158 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen, mainly east of Baileyton. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the next couple of hours, especially to the west of Baileyton. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baileyton, Jearoldstown and Romeo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
